Utterance: Hi! Welcome back! How have you been since our last session?
Hi, Ellie! I’ve been doing better. I had my chat with the event planning company, and it went really well!
That’s fantastic news! What was the experience like for you?
It was nerve-wracking at first, but once we started talking, it felt more like a friendly conversation. I think I made a good impression.
That’s great to hear! What feedback did they give you?
They said they appreciated my enthusiasm and that they’d be in touch about potential opportunities.
That’s a positive sign! How do you feel about waiting to hear back?
I’m trying to stay optimistic, but I can’t help but feel anxious about it.
It’s completely natural to feel that way, especially when you’re waiting for news. Have you tried any of the coping strategies we discussed previously?
Yes, I’ve been practicing deep breathing exercises, and they help a lot when I start to feel overwhelmed.
That’s wonderful! Deep breathing can be very grounding. Have you found any other techniques that work for you?
I started journaling a bit. It helps me sort through my thoughts.
Journaling is a great way to process emotions and reflect on your experiences. What have you been writing about?
Mostly about my feelings regarding the divorce and the changes in my life. It feels good to get it all out.
That’s a healthy outlet. Writing can provide clarity and relief. Would you like to explore more coping strategies together?
Yes, I’d love that.
How about we discuss mindfulness techniques? Have you ever tried mindfulness meditation?
I’ve heard of it but never really tried it.
Mindfulness meditation can help you stay present and reduce anxiety. Would you like to try a short guided meditation together?
Sure, that sounds interesting.
Okay, let’s take a moment to find a comfortable position. Close your eyes if you feel comfortable. Take a deep breath in... and out.
*breathes deeply*
Focus on your breath. Notice the sensation of the air entering and leaving your body. If your mind wanders, gently bring it back to your breath.
*breathes deeply*
Great job! Let’s do this for a few more moments.
*continues breathing*
Now, slowly open your eyes when you’re ready. How did that feel?
It was calming. I feel more centered now.
I’m glad to hear that! Practicing mindfulness regularly can help you manage stress and anxiety. Would you like to set a goal to try it a few times this week?
Yes, I think I can commit to that.
Excellent! We can check in on how it goes next session. Is there anything else you’d like to discuss today?
I think I’m good for now. I feel like I have some strategies to work with.
That’s great! Remember, it’s all about progress, not perfection. I’m proud of you for taking these steps.
Thank you, Ellie. I appreciate your support.
You’re welcome! I look forward to hearing how everything unfolds. Take care until next time!
Bye!
